title: How to Make a Giant Spaghetti Stuffed Meatball

parts.name: Making the Spaghetti and Meatball Mixture

steps.headline: Boil the dry pasta in a large pot of salted water.
steps.description: Cook for about 7-8 minutes until the spaghetti is al dente.

steps.headline: Drain the spaghetti in a colander and shake it around to remove excess water.
Saute the olive oil and garlic in a large iron skillet.
steps.description: Cook over medium heat until fragrant.

steps.headline: Add the tomato sauce and crushed tomatoes.
steps.description: Stir and bring the mixture to a boil.

steps.headline: Sprinkle in the salt, red pepper, basil, and dried oregano.
steps.description: Mix well and bring the heat down to a simmer until it starts to thicken.

steps.headline: Fold in the spaghetti with one cup of the tomato sauce.
steps.description: Stir with a wooden spoon until fully coated. Set aside the spaghetti for later, and leave the extra tomato sauce for garnish at the end.

steps.headline: Make the meatball mixture.
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, onion, parsley, garlic, eggs, seltzer water, salt, breadcrumbs, Pecorino Romano cheese, and Worcestershire sauce. Mix well until fully combined.

steps.headline: Remove one-third of the meatball mixture and set aside.
Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.
Cover a large oven-safe bowl with aluminum foil.
Press down the meatball mixture firmly and mold it on the bowl.
Stuff the meatball with the spaghetti and spread it around to fill the meatball.
Cover the meatball with the remaining one-third cup of meat.
steps.description: Press down firmly and close the edges to create the giant meatball.

steps.headline: Bake the giant meatball in the oven for about one hour until it fully cooks.
Serve.
steps.description: Remove the meatball from the oven and place it on a serving plate. Garnish the meatball with the rest of the sauce and the Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

text: Making the Spaghetti and Meatball Mixture Boil the dry pasta in a large pot of salted water. Cook for about 7-8 minutes until the spaghetti is al dente. Drain the spaghetti in a colander and shake it around to remove excess water.  Saute the olive oil and garlic in a large iron skillet. Cook over medium heat until fragrant. Add the tomato sauce and crushed tomatoes. Stir and bring the mixture to a boil. Sprinkle in the salt, red pepper, basil, and dried oregano. Mix well and bring the heat down to a simmer until it starts to thicken. Fold in the spaghetti with one cup of the tomato sauce. Stir with a wooden spoon until fully coated. Set aside the spaghetti for later, and leave the extra tomato sauce for garnish at the end. Make the meatball mixture. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, onion, parsley, garlic, eggs, seltzer water, salt, breadcrumbs, Pecorino Romano cheese, and Worcestershire sauce. Mix well until fully combined. Remove one-third of the meatball mixture and set aside.  Stuffing and Baking Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 175° Celsius.  Cover a large oven-safe bowl with aluminum foil.  Press down the meatball mixture firmly and mold it on the bowl.  Stuff the meatball with the spaghetti and spread it around to fill the meatball.  Cover the meatball with the remaining one-third cup of meat. Press down firmly and close the edges to create the giant meatball. Bake the giant meatball in the oven for about one hour until it fully cooks.  Serve. Remove the meatball from the oven and place it on a serving plate. Garnish the meatball with the rest of the sauce and the Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
